document.docAuthor: Maruyama, Munetoshi, Klimaszewski, Jan & Gusarov, Vladimir
document.masterDocTitle: Osakatheta yasukoae, a new intertidal genus and species of athetine rove beetles (Coleoptera, Staphylinidae, Aleocharinae) from Japan

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Osakatheta yasukoae, a new intertidal genus and species of athetine rove beetles (Coleoptera, Staphylinidae, Aleocharinae) from Japan

heading.emphasis:
Osakatheta Maruyama, Klimaszewski & Gusarov
, gen. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type species.
Osakatheta yasukoae Maruyama, Klimaszewski & Gusarov
, sp. nov.

Diagnosis.
Osakatheta
can be readily distinguished from most athetine genera by the erect setae covering the whole body.

Etymology.
Osakatheta
is a combination of “Ôsaka”, the type locality of the type species, and “
Atheta
”, the type genus of the tribe Athetini. Gender feminine.
Distribution. Japan : Honshû. So far known from Honshû, Japan . It is probably more broadly distributed in the other regions of East Asia .
